task_summary: The robot is tasked to pick up the white tube from atop the black shelf, using a sequence of perception, approach, and grasp actions grounded in visual feedback.

task_long_description.overview: This episode involves a robotic manipulator operating in a domestic or lab setting, instructed to pick up a small white cylindrical tube from the top surface of a dark cube shelf. The scene contains another white object (likely a block) and assorted background furniture. The robot must detect the tube, position its end-effector above it, prepare the gripper, compute and execute a grasp from the side, and verify successful grasp using visual and proprioceptive cues. No placing or transfer is requested. The tube is the exclusive target; all other objects remain untouched.
preconditions: Tube is present on shelf top surface
stepwise_plan: Scan for tube if not visible
success_criteria: Tube is securely held in the gripper
No collisions or dropped object post grasp
failure_and_recovery: Tube not detected: retry scan up to 3 times
Grasp fails: report and halt, or retry (not implemented here)
Tube slips or not in gripper: failure
task_long_description.termination: Tree exits true when tube detected in gripper after side grasp.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the tube is visible in the robot's field of view.
Scans workspace for tube up to 3 times in a grid pattern.
Moves end-effector above tube at 5cm offset.
Opens the gripper to 6cm width for side grasp.
Computes a side grasp pose for tube and stores under std_side.
Approaches and aligns to tube within 5mm tolerance.
Executes grasp at computed side pose.
Checks if tube is securely held by the gripper.

failure_modes: Tube cannot be localized due to occlusion
recovery_strategy: Retry scan for up to 3 attempts if tube not visible
Abort on grasp failure (no retry in current tree)
assumptions: Instruction refers to tube, which is visually clear and present in all frames; frames support 'side grasp', not top or suction.
No timing, force, or 'gentle/quick' constraints stated in instruction, so defaults used.
Only picking is performed; no transfer, place, or retreat observed or encoded.

expected_success_criteria: Tube detected and grasped from side
Tube visually held in gripper at episode end
